abstract: Americans who identify with Occupy Wall Street say income inequality, eroding standards of living and corporate greed drive their support.
snippet: Americans who identify with Occupy Wall Street say income inequality, eroding standards of living and corporate greed drive their support.
lead_paragraph: Offshoots of the Occupy Wall Street movement have spread across the United States with organized protests coming to life in dozens of cities throughout the country. But are the demonstrations resonating with the general public?

headline.main: Views of the '99 Percent': Corporate Power Is Up While Living Standards are Down
